citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC).
citations.narrative:
The IACUC was not able to review and approve changes in a protocol prior to implementation. On December 8, 2023, the
facility self-reported to OLAW a non-compliance involving deviation from a protocol that was not approved by the IACUC.
The incident occurred on October 26, 2023, and involved an inoculation procedure performed on 3 ferrets that did not
adhere to the IACUC approved protocol. The ferrets received an intra-muscular injection administered in a standard
housing room. It is understood the inoculation procedure detailed in the approved protocol was to be administered under
ABSL2 conditions. Medical records evaluated by the APHIS inspector for the affected animals did not indicate any
untoward affects to the animals from this deviation in the protocol.
In response to the incident, the IACUC Chair appointed a subcommittee to investigate the matter and the subcommittee
presented its report to the IACUC on December 19, 2023. The committee determined the matter was a serious
noncompliance. The following corrective actions were approved by the IACUC in response to the incident: review of the
details of the lab’s IACUC protocols, audit of the affected lab, additional personnel training requirements, and amendment
of the affected protocol.
Failure of notification to request changes in a protocol resulted in the IACUC's inability to carry out its function to review
and approve proposed significant changes in care and use of animals in order to ensure compliance with the Animal
Welfare Act. The IACUC must review and approve significant changes regarding the use of animals in ongoing activities
prior to implementation.
Correct by April 18, 2024, onward. Corrective actions have been taken by the time of inspection.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the attending veterinarians.
